meanings.definition: A unit of length equal to one billionth of a meter.
meanings.sent1: A nanometer is so tiny that it is hard to imagine its size.
meanings.sent2: Scientists use a nanometer to measure the size of atoms.
meanings.sent3: I tried to measure the ant with a nanometer, but it was too small to see!
meanings.sent4: The nanometer acted like a magical ruler, revealing the minuscule world around us.
meanings.sent5: The concept of a nanometer helps us grasp the incredible smallness of certain objects.

meanings.definition: A nanometer is used to measure very small distances, such as the length of molecules or wavelengths of light.
meanings.sent1: The scientist used a nanometer to determine the size of the virus.
meanings.sent2: A nanometer can help us understand the scale of DNA strands.
meanings.sent3: The nanometer played hide and seek with the tiny particles in the lab.
meanings.sent4: Her precision was like a nanometer, always accurate and exact.
meanings.sent5: The nanometer revealed the intricate details of the microscopic world.
